column4: Help, anyone experienced a missing capital 'c'?    I tried pressing SHIFT-c and nothing comes out.  All other characters works, both UPPER and lower.  Why isn't the character 'c' working?
the letter 'c' works if on capslock, see this...  C  .. but that's besides the point, why can't shift-c make it capitalized?
if capslock is on, shift+c will be in lower case
capslock is OFF,  I know what I am doing.
just that it's weird that capital-c doesn't work , when the rest of the keyboard works with SHIFT keys.
just a note to let you know:  if i keep the capslock ON, pressing SHIFT-c would not come out, but on its own, it came out as capital c.
when I typed dmesg | grep -i input, the relevant came up which reads:  AT Translated Set 2 keyboard as /devices/platform/i8042/serio0/input/input1.   Mean anything
check the plug, be sure it's not loose.
the keyboard model says: Generic 105-Key (intl) Pc
I can type the characters, so the connection is OK.
maybe I try a different keyboard????
if you have spare, yes try it.
